page.title: 10POPULATION
page.content: Alness is a small town on the north side of the Cromarty Firth. Until the late 1960's its population was under 2,000. The main forms of employment were farming,forestry and quarrying in the surrounding countryside with distilling being the major manufacturing industry. The development of oil-related industries in the Cromarty Firth and the building of an aluminium smelter at nearby Invergordon at the end of the 1960's led to an influx of people from other parts of the country. Alness became a dormitory town and its population increased rapidly from 2,800 in 1971 to 6,300 in 1981. Despite the closure of the smelter in 1981 and a current unemployment level of 26%,the total population of the town has remained around the 1981 level.
